displayname: Tajima Hiroyuki 田嶋 宏行
biography: Tajima Hiroyuki completed his training at the department of fine arts at the Nihon University in Tokyo in 1932. In 1962, he received the newcomer's prize of the association of modern art, of which he became a member. He is also a member of the Japanese engraving association. In 1962 he exhibited at the Japanese contemporary art exhibition in Tokyo. In 1962-1964 his work was seen at the Northwest International Print Exhibition. From 1961 he exhibited annually in Tokyo and in 1964 his woodblock engravings were seen at the Tokyo international print biennale. GDA
